name: Monix Task Foundations
description: Fundamental topics for learning to program using Monix Task

lessons.title: Introduction
lessons.description: This is the introduction to Monix course, which is intended for Functional Programming beginners who have had little or no exposure to effect types, like Monix Task. In the beginner level of the course we will start from nothing, learn how to use a Task, and see how it can be used in real-life applications.

lessons.title: Task Creation and Execution
lessons.description: Task[A] represents a specification for a computation that, after execution, produces either a value of type A, fails with an error, or potentially never terminates. In this lesson, we will learn how to create and execute Task.

lessons.title: Basic Transformations
lessons.description: This lesson explains how to transform a Task, and what we mean by pure functional programming.

lessons.title: Error Handling
lessons.description: Task can fail with an error for a variety of reasons. In this lesson, we will learn how to recover from errors.

lessons.title: Basic Concurrency
lessons.description: One of the main appeals of Monix Task is its rich support for asynchronous operations. In this lesson we will learn about concurrency, and how it relates to Monix.

lessons.title: Thread Management
lessons.description: In this lesson we will learn more about lower level details of the concurrency mechanisms that power Monix Task. The lesson covers thread pools, and how tasks are scheduled to execute.

lessons.title: Resource Safety
lessons.description: Many tasks use resources, such as a connection pool, a filehandle, or a socket. This lesson explains how to write resource-safe code with Task, and what its advantages are over the standard library.
